column4: sabiancrash: oh ok thanks, my bad if i was expecting too much.
honestly i think im gonna go back to windows
linux is a bit faster but its really quite worthless since its not compatible with anything
cell thunder: haha dont be rude man. Look you gotta see this from my perspective;

everytime i try and download an app from ubuntu i get that "dependency" issue and it wont work, and the one thing that i actually use my computer for (ipod) wont work. I guess linux is cool if your into programing and coding and stuff, but im not a computer-savy person.
dependency issue?
could you say a little more about what this dependency issue you have is
also i'm pretty sure the ipod is supported
can you be more specific about what happened? screenshot?
you can put it on imagebin.org
okay just give me one second
ok its uploaded to imagebin
odd
do you have any odd PPA's set
that version of amarok isn't the one in the standard repos, i don't think
can you open your /etc/apt/sources.list file and put it on a pastebin?
Im sorry sir but I dont know what any of that means, and i dont know how to open any of those or where to find them
it's a text file
pastebin is like imagebin for text
paste.ubuntu.com
you copy the link it gives you and paste it here so we know where it is
ok i pasted it into paste bin (sorry for being repetitive...im kinda talking to both of you so i dont wanna be rude and ignore one of you or anything)
